And hopefully with all our support, some of these businesses will flourish and bring more jobs, know how and opportunities to the locals. I also believe by improving woman`s independent in the society, their kids and especially daughters will be able to go to school and break the cycle of poverty and have a open and more tolerate society. And hopefully my next trip will bring me to one of these countries and I will be able to meet them personally.

lender.occupational_info: I type lots of different reports such as operative notes, discharge summaries, admitting notes, emergency room notes, etc., for patients in either a hospital or clinic setting. I work at home. All of my work is downloaded onto my computer from that hospital or clinic. I have a headset to listen to what the doctors are saying, and I type the report the doctor dictates. As soon as I am done with a report, it goes immediately (through the computer) to the hospital or clinic that I am typing for, and it becomes part of that patient's medical record. I have been doing this work for close to 20 years now.

I want to give some of that back by helping those who have even less than I did when my dreams emerged.
lender.occupational_info:
We are retired from regular jobs and owning and operating rental properties. We have been living in and remodeling a 100 year old farm house for the past 9 years. We have created an art studio and a workshop in the 150 year old barn. On top of that, we have done extensive clean up and changed the landscape on the 3 acre home site.
I am also a computer geek and an avid kite flyer while my wife is fast becoming a great oil painter. I build computers and experiment endlessly with related tech and digital photography. I also learned to sew in order to create my own kites. I created and now maintain a web site for the Great Lakes Kitefliers Society www.flyglks.com

Long live and power to Kiva!
lender.occupational_info:
We're retired medical professionals and started a 501 (C) (3) nonprofit respite camp (SanctuaryCamp.us) in Colorado. Eventually we would like to partner with a local Yampa River Valley rancher to construct a 2 cabin camp accomodate visiting families with a loved one diagnosed with serious disease for a few days of respite.
Our initial fund raiser (2009) and identity recognition event was to host a benefit Holiday ice hockey tournament. Funds raised helped to fund the Wounded Warriors ski camp and for the youth, adaptive skiing program held in Steamboat Springs. Our second holiday hockey tournament (2010) raised money, awareness, register and fund 11 new, community, adult hockey player participants as registered, bone marrow donors with Be The Match-National Marrow Donor Program. Already one of those player participants has been contacted to donate marrow in behalf of a recipient in Minnesota. Woohoo!

lender.occupational_info:
I'm a visual artist. When I'm in the studio, my focus is on the work in front of me. As I work, I communicate with my art; when it is finished, I hope to communicate through it.
I'm also a teacher. When I'm in the classroom, my focus is on the students I teach. We work together, we communicate; as the work is completed, we grow in our appreciation of the gifts we each have brought to barter in the mysterious process we call learning.
And, I'm a user of technology. It helps me be organized and more clear in how and what I communicate in my daily life. It's a wonderful tool, and although I'm not defined solely through my use of it, I do know enough about it to be a mentor to others.
Over the years I've become interested in the place where Art, Education and Technology overlap...especially as it relates to folks who learn or perceive differently. I've written articles and led workshops on issues such as Art, Technology, Self Esteem, and Teaching folks with Language Based Learning Disabilities. Wherever I go, I'm asked if I do consulting work for schools or educational institutions. The short answer is, "Yes". If you'd like to contact me so that we can discuss opportunities and options for change, I'd be happy to speak with you.
